block.p: In 1994, Martin Marietta Aerospace, now part of Lockheed Martin, provided technical advice to a Hong Kong client that was trying to solve a problem with China's commercial satellites. To settle civil charges filed by the State Department, Lockheed Martin agreed to pay $13 million for failing to get a United States license before helping the Hong Kong company, which had strong ties to the government in Beijing. No one knows if the technology helped the Chinese with their military satellites.
